summary: One way to award a competitive federal contract is to choose based on cost, when the cheapest option will suffice. But how does DOD decide when that's the case? While there are some general criteria for using this process, DOD's regulations don't provide specific criteria for making determinations. That will change when DOD updates its regulations as directed by a 2016 law. We found that...
title: Defense Contracting: DOD Should Clarify Criteria for Using Lowest Price Technically Acceptable Process
